programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a pair of duelling pistols and a vintage airboat, and try to sell them at an auction in New Orleans.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers make some risky bids when they attend an auction at Fort Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny brings her mother to an auction, and Moe annoys Mary by bidding for a risky locker.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a farm in need of vital funds, before exploring a boarded-up cheese factory and an underground railroad site.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The race is on to be crowned king of the swamp as a new 30-day season of alligator hunting begins on the Louisiana Bayou.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a Second World War pilot's jacket and a piece of the Apollo 11 spacecraft, and try to determine if J Edgar Hoover's signature in a book is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the prices of an antique pistol, a mining certificate issued to Mark Twain and a valuable Spider-Man comic.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After his sacking, Rich returns to the shop in a last-ditch effort to win back his job. Seth continues his attempt to take over the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An electric chair gives Rich the chance to get back in Les's good books, and Seth hatches a scheme that could make a fortune for the store.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts question what probes on Mars may have found over the past 40 years, asking if Nasa could be hiding proof of life on the Red Planet from the public.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries. Alongside experts, he explores the puzzling construction of Puma Punku in Bolivia, contemplating whether advanced technology could have been used to carve the ancient temple complex.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary and Moe compete with a huge crowd of bidders, and the locker they are after is guaranteed to make Moe's wife angry.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Take a Deep Breath, It's Lesa
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Conroe, where they come face to face with an old adversary.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Shop owner Les is reluctant to trust a group of clients who tell him a story, and he later makes an important discovery.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is shocked to discover that Les has brought back ex-employee Amy, whom he suspects may have made a mistake that could cost the store thousands of dollars.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine memoirs of the Duke and Duchess of Windsor signed by the couple themselves, and a collection of tin army trucks from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine rare hand-made Pinocchio dolls, a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler, and a valuable baseball card from 1909.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find an antique barber's chair, two lawnmowers and a voodoo chest, and try selling the items on at an auction in Louisiana.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen start a bidding war at an auction in Washington, DC, where they set out to sell a Civil War-era revolver and some South African gold coins.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: An inquiry reveals the shocking truth about why two trains crashed in the Rocky Mountains, and leads to revelations about those who run Canada's freight trains.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether alien encounters influenced the establishing acts of the Founding Fathers as he travels to Washington, DC.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating whether spiritual leaders known as shamans, who have healed and protected people throughout history really have contact with extraterrestrial realms.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman catches her boyfriend trying to sell her ring, and Les gets his hands on some valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is tempted to break one of the shop's most important rules when a fast-talking client catches him off-guard.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley discovers a potential robber hiding in the fridge, but Les ignores her cries to increase security - which is a decision he may regret come nightfall.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finds himself unable to stop spending, and is under pressure to make sales before being branded a hoarder.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a vintage military motorcycle and replica cannon in Arlington, Virginia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a rare punt gun after winning two units at an auction in Pasadena.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy drop in on Killeneure Castle, before rock 'n' rolling to Limerick City for pop memorabilia from U2 and Thin Lizzy, along with the bar that film star Oliver Reed drank at.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Cindy and Rick look forward to returning to the auction in Western where they cleaned up last time, while Paul urges Bogart to act on his feelings.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an upscale area of Toronto for another auction, while Roy is on the lookout for high-end items, but needs to be able to scupper Rick and Cindy's plans.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the biggest mistakes made by bidders in the series' history - as well as previously unseen footage of an explosive argument.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find an antique barber's chair, two lawnmowers and a voodoo chest, and try selling the items on at an auction in Louisiana.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen start a bidding war at an auction in Washington, DC, where they set out to sell a Civil War-era revolver and some South African gold coins.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They attempt to build a tower for an egg to see who can get it the highest and make a video 'blooper'.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stand-up and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Grace Dent and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten contracts a computer virus, and the crew are forced to enter his electronic mindscape, where they find themselves in a virtual reality Wild West town. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people in Glasgow to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people in Whitby to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Jordan Andino visits Tucson, where chef Ramiro spends the day roasting a whole pig. His late night best seller is the Pasco Nachos, loaded with cheesy sauce and juicy pork.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A look back at the biggest items Mike and Frank ever picked. Picking was easy - getting the behemoths home was the hardest part.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori win a surfboard, while Jesse and Papa Bear team up to bid on a safe protected by barbed wire.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters and the Stig enter a 24-hour endurance race at Silverstone, which proves to be one of their toughest challenges to date. Plus, James May races against BMX bikers around Budapest in a Fiat 500 and Jeremy Clarkson test-drives the Ascari A10. Actor Keith Allen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Montreal, Canada where replicas of a DeLorean and the Ghostbusters' Ecto-1 are among the vehicles taking part in the downhill race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They have to fill an egg cup with tears, remember an Aussie rules football team and play Taskmaster squash.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Broadcaster and former MP Gyles Brandreth, comedian and presenter Adam Hills and singer Melanie C - the woman who will forever be known as Sporty Spice - compete to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Host Frank Skinner has to choose between dislikes including passwords, Â£2 coins and movie spoilers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, actor Charles Dance (Game of Thrones) and comedienne and actress Andi Osho compete to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Frank Skinner hosts the light-hearted panel show.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and broadcaster Joan Bakewell joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the offbeat panel quiz and finds out how much Shappi Khorsandi, Ross Noble, Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the world of journalism, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Lucy remembers the time she was in an episode of Doctors acting alongside Fleabag star Phoebe Waller Bridge. Jon's never seen the footage. Until now.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Jo Brand, John Sessions, Dara O Briain and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the topic of jumble, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Desiree Burch, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Glenn Moore. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They have to fill an egg cup with tears, remember an Aussie rules football team and play Taskmaster squash.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett travels from Britain to Jerusalem via Sicily, examining the expansion and unchecked ambition of the Norman empire, and how its impact still resonates in today's culture and politics. He discovers how, under the leadership of Scandinavian raider Rollo, these descendants of the Vikings first established themselves in northern France and became an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The use of propaganda in Hitler's Nazi regime. The first episode examines the Fuehrer's fascination with propaganda, which began in the trenches of the First World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: The True Story of the Mary Celeste
programme.desc: On December 4, 1872, the Mary Celeste was found adrift in the Atlantic with its cargo fully intact, yet with no one on board. Experts use CGI and fresh evidence in a bid to solve the mystery of the ship and learn how and why its crew disappeared.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The decade of propaganda, impassioned speeches, newspaper articles, posters and campaigning that all led to one moment - Hitler being made Chancellor of Germany in January 1933.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe receives some bad news from Collette, and his actions end up getting him into trouble. Meanwhile, an unexpected guest opens old wounds for Sam.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A case of sexual assault puts Stacey in a difficult position and threatens to divide loyalties in the camp. Starring Kate O'Malley and Con O'Neill.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Drug dealer Adi Mateen is forced to reveal his true identity in a desperate bid to save Lance from gun-brandishing local youth Jordan Tomlin, and Samantha confronts Phil about Kate Maltby's pregnancy. Gina convinces herself that Adam is still hiding something, while Sheelagh works on a harassment case with Gabriel - only to discover the victim is his girlfriend.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric has plenty of problems on his hands as the new ward opens - the thermostat breaks down and he is forced to take charge of an operation personally. Diane and Chrissie get into a heated argument over Owen in front of a patient, while Donna applies for a new job. However, she is surprised to learn Mickie has already been appointed, and wonders why she didn't say anything.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam finds himself in a dangerous situation, while everyone waits anxiously for news about Josh and George.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is worried about her trial tomorrow, Franck is still hoping to persuade her to change her mind about her plea. Events turn bad when the youngsters decide to go to a disco.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline has a showdown with Mandy over Aidan, and Frank tries to help Pat face going to Court. Arthur has to make a difficult phone call, while Sharon has to accept Phil's plans.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A massive explosion rips through the Woolwich ferry, and Blue Watch is forced to join forces with Hallam and the Fire Boat crew to tackle the ensuing blaze. Meanwhile, the situation between Kevin and Sally comes to breaking point.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: An old friend of the Macdonald family arrives in Glenbogle, but while Archie is pleased to see him, Lexie is concerned about his drinking problem and becomes suspicious when he asks for money to invest in his business. Meanwhile, Molly's attempt to save a wolf cub from death is accidentally frustrated by Kilwillie.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: As Anna agonises about breaking the news of her pregnancy to Simon, a glamorous woman stirs up trouble between them. Meanwhile, Stephen and Jacqui prepare to leave Skelthwaite to start their new life in Glasgow, but Vic is subdued by the prospect of losing his son, daughter-in-law and grandson, and Henry realises he's got a fight on his hands if he wants to win back Jess from Hussan.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy is feeling neglected, while Nellie has made the momentous decision to go away with Derek.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin announces Gladys and Spike's engagement to the local papers - much to their annoyance - but all is not as it seems. Comedy, starring Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The boys discuss life, love and women - particularly the unpleasant ones working in the cafe. Later, Compo realises he has lost his house key. Michael Bates, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A Sudanese politician vows to go on hunger strike until the UK returns the skull of an important 19th-century ruler to his country. While searching for the article, Boyd is asked to re-open the case of an Iraqi shopkeeper murdered in front of his daughter 20 years ago. A tip-off from a Foreign Office official gives the team a lead - and as it probes further, it seems the two investigations could be connected. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian finds the library card of cold case victim Dr Richard Symes, leading the team to reinvestigate the death of the professor, who perished after falling from the roof of his college three years' previously. Sandra and Gerry interview Symes' widow, who believes principal Jeremy Ventham drove her husband to suicide following a conflict over teaching methods. Crime drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy bring a new suspect in for questioning and in a search of this suspect's premises, Ellie finds devastating new evidence linking him to the crime. Back at the station, he gives them his detailed version of events, but when they dig deeper they begin to doubt his story, while DC Katie Harford confronts Ellie and Hardy with an uncomfortable truth about her role in the investigation. The fact that Ian has taken a personal item of Trish's without her knowledge comes to light.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team are joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Newcastle answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Kathryn, Anne, Jane and Henry pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show - A Coronavirus Special
programme.desc: The financial journalist presents money-saving tips to help consumers cope with the current economic climate, offering expert advice on everything from premium bonds, student loans and tax credits to supermarket loyalty schemes and high-street shopping.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Trump and the Virus: America in Crisis - Tonight
programme.desc: How seriously could the coronavirus pandemic damage President's Trump's chances of re-election later this year? As the United States grapples with a full-blown health crisis, ITV's Washington Correspondent Robert Moore asks whether his controversial leadership style has properly addressed or even exacerbated the challenge ahead.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having previously toured their own countries, Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix now hit the highways of of the States - although in the first episode, they are in Mexico, on a mission to taste the world's best breakfast. Along the way, the trio take part in a chili-eating competition, have a beach buggy race and watch some traditional Mexican wrestling - but it isn't long before they are persuaded not take part.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. This time, Security Officer Estefania investigates an oddly shaped object, and Passenger Experience Manager Harry deals with a medical emergency. Elsewhere, Border Force Bob helps a circus performer with visa troubles.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Andrew is pushed to the edge and as he runs out of options, he concocts a plan to take drastic measures. But first, he will need help. In the present day, a vital piece of evidence comes to light and Laura seeks to discover its origin. Now in a desperate position, she must use all her wits to get the information she needs, but with Katy and Liam's assistance, she is led to a startling new suspect. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Zoe Tapper, Richie Campbell and Katherine Kelly.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne and James are at loggerheads following the revelations at the Brockenhursts' party. With Oliver fixated on discovering the origins of his father's new protege, Susan uses the opportunity to plan a covert trip to meet with a new friend, and enlists her maid Speer to keep the true nature of the rendezvous under wraps. Meanwhile, Lady Templemore begins work on her lavish plans for her daughter's wedding, but much to her disappointment, Lady Maria seems fixated on someone other than her fiance.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks out a Porsche 912E, and with help from Edd China, he aims to address the years of neglect and make a return on his investment.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate to move more rock, the rookies get a lesson in the dangerous art of bomb-making. Plus, Kelly is forced to sell her precious reserve of stones.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr and his sons put aside their differences for an appearance on TV show Larry King Live.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike braves a mission in California's Central Valley, while Kevin finds himself at the mercy of a vengeful mechanic.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A guide to the process behind making oil lamps and chocolate mints.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how ice buckets are manufactured, and putting together a replica of a human skeleton.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to build emergency bridges that can take the weight of a tank, make a marker pen that never fades, and design a 200mph superbike.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tensions rise as the start of the new crab season approaches, and the fleet loses one of its vessels.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn Pomrenke tries to show his 17-year-old son the ropes on the Christine Rose, but their visions of the future do not match.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate to move more rock, the rookies get a lesson in the dangerous art of bomb-making. Plus, Kelly is forced to sell her precious reserve of stones.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of Â£5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: An ownership dispute hampers car restorer Wayne Carini's purchase of a rare Ferrari 275 GS.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini races in the Hershey Hill Climb and sells his Shelby Mustang GT 500 KR convertible at auction.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: In March 2006, the Queen of the North sank after running aground on Gil Island in Wright Sound. This edition examines what caused this strong and sturdy vessel to sink.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The rookies on board the Kodiak begin to discover how difficult crabbing is, and Sig battles his brother as well as the seas.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The self-proclaimed 'best dredger in Nome' quits the fleet, and Shawn takes his daughter to work - but he soon has his hands full with a hydraulic leak.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on the hunt for rare objects in a Devizes dealership inside a pub. And, in Leigh-on-Sea, he finds an array of unusual objects salvaged from building sites.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With the end of the season fast approaching, the rookies risk cave-ins at their abandoned mine claim. Deep underground, Bomb King George is trapped in the blast zone.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks out a Porsche 912E, and with help from Edd China, he aims to address the years of neglect and make a return on his investment.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: There is a heavy-duty surprise in store for presenter Drew Pritchard at a magnificent country house in Scotland, while the team visits a former veterinary college turned arts centre in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead claim ownership of a seriously distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman, and hopes a custom-built surf inspired makeover will be enough to attract a buyer.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Arthur brings in his 1967 Cyclone, hoping the team can make it better than new. Antonio and Andres challenge Dan to build the fastest Mustang CS in Mexico.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology that allows unmanned aerial vehicles to fight crime, how a potash mine under the sea can help prevent starvation and the secrets of football design.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How does a helicopter loop the loop? Plus, learn how a 200,000 square metre ball park in the hottest city in the US is cooled?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on repairing a 1973 Chevrolet Camaro, and hope they will be able to make a profit on the time, energy and funds they put into restoring it.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Finding the killer of a woman who was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The distinctive grass on the course provided enough evidence to lead the police to two suspects.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In February 2008, Christopher Duncan left his apartment in San Antonio, Texas, and disappeared. Police had little to go on until surveillance footage offered the potential to reveal the identity of a dangerous killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 50-year-old George Jodoin, a New Hampshire man known throughout his community in the small town of Auburn. Arthur Collins, friend of the victim, was convicted in June 2015, 14 years after Jodoin was shot several times in the head.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: One surviving victim of a serial killer gives testimony to support the forensic evidence against her attacker, and brings the murderer to justice.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team pulls out all the stops to save a newborn foal when it is found with its abandoned mother.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown turns his attention to an amorous rabbit, a malnourished platypus and a pet that has escaped multiple times.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Adrianna's choice of dress leads to a nervous fitting, while Joey hopes to make a decision, having tried on more than 100 gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cat and her fiancee Nicole both need dresses for their beach wedding, and the team are challenged to find them two different gowns that are still complementary.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown feels the pressure when he comes to the aid of a distressed Sumatran tiger with a tooth problem.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When Boris the Staffy was born he had a cleft palate, and Chris attempts a type of complex surgery that has never been performed in the country before to help save his life.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The work of the Michigan Humane Society, a four-strong team of animal welfare officers that deals with more than 4,000 cases of cruelty and neglect every year.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The prosecution of an owner of a pair of pit bull terriers suffering from severe mange is considered, while a starving and dehydrated puppy is rescued. Plus, investigators have to break things up when two pit bulls attack each other.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Amy Bradley, who vanished in March 1998 while on a family cruise through the Caribbean. Her disappearance came after a night out dancing in the ship's disco.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tyarra Williams, who vanished in January 2016. Tips suggested the 19-year-old frm North Carolina may have fallen prey to human trafficking.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How modern investigation techniques coupled with broken shards from a car headlight helped in the case of a hit-and-run death of a Michigan cyclist, leading officers to both the vehicle and its driver.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A Star Wars-obsessed bride wants to look like Princess Leia, while a Southern belle wants a groovy dress for her hippie-themed wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jessica wants to incorporate camouflage into her wedding gown, while Kaleeta - who hates shopping - needs help to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: ABC News bride Linsey is on a mission to find her dream wedding gown, but everything her friends and family suggest fails to meet her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessie and her grandmother struggle to see eye to eye regarding the price range of her perfect gown, while Maria seeks her sisters' approval at her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tracy is on the hunt for a fun, flirty gown for her forthcoming Las Vegas wedding, while second-time bride Isabel selects a dress without her daughters' approval.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Small-town bride Lindsay has big, princess-themed dreams for her wedding dress. Plus, bride-to-be Bailey has simple tastes, but her bling-loving mum is on sparkle patrol.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: With three items saved from an Altrincham skip, Sarah Moore spruces up a table, Guy Trench helps an old vice find a new home, and Daniel Heath put his twist on a pair of chairs.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a Â£50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Chuck weighs almost 50 stone and it has hindered every aspect of his life. This film follows his efforts to take control and reclaim the life and independence that is slipping through his fingers.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A psychological profile of William Inmon, who confessed to murdering three people in Arizona when he was 21 - making him America's youngest serial killer.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: When Patrick Gilhuley was shot dead by his partner Virginia Vertetis in 2014, she claimed it was an act of self-defence. However, her ex-husbands provided evidence of her violent past leading to a 30-year prison sentence being issued.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part two of two. The veteran broadcaster meets more inmates inside two of Indiana's most dangerous women's prisons. Among them are Dawn Hopkins, who was sentenced to life for murdering her three-month-old son, and Sarah 'Cindy' White, who was incarcerated as a teenager and will spend the rest of her life behind bars. The journalist also hears the remarkable story of Linda Darby who, after escaping from jail in 1972, spent the next 35 years on the run - before the law finally caught up with her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, with tiny but unmistakable clues that pointed to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular DJ was found murdered in a local garden, police raced to find answers. With no other leads, detectives turned to a blood spatter expert.
